00054 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LDLM

00079 static int
00080 ldlm_inodebits_compat_queue(struct list_head *queue, struct ldlm_lock *req,
00081                             struct list_head *work_list)
00082 {
00083         struct list_head *tmp;
00084         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00085         __u64 req_bits = req->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits;
00086         int compat = 1;
00087         ENTRY;
00088 
00089         /* There is no sense in lock with no bits set, I think.
00090          * Also, such a lock would be compatible with any other bit lock */
00091         LASSERT(req_bits != 0);
00092 
00093         list_for_each(tmp, queue) {
00094                 struct list_head *mode_tail;
00095 
00096                 lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock, l_res_link);
00097 
00098                 /* We stop walking the queue if we hit ourselves so we don't
00099                  * take conflicting locks enqueued after us into account,
00100                  * or we'd wait forever. */
00101                 if (req == lock)
00102                         RETURN(compat);
00103 
00104                 /* last lock in mode group */
00105                 LASSERT(lock->l_sl_mode.prev != NULL);
00106                 mode_tail = &list_entry(lock->l_sl_mode.prev,
00107                                         struct ldlm_lock,
00108                                         l_sl_mode)->l_res_link;
00109 
00110                 /* if reqest lock is not COS_INCOMPAT and COS is disabled,
00111                  * they are compatible, IOW this request is from a local
00112                  * transaction on a DNE system. */
00113                 if (lock->l_req_mode == LCK_COS && !ldlm_is_cos_incompat(req) &&
00114                     !ldlm_is_cos_enabled(req)) {
00115                         /* jump to last lock in mode group */
00116                         tmp = mode_tail;
00117                         continue;
00118                 }
00119 
00120                 /* locks' mode are compatible, bits don't matter */
00121                 if (lockmode_compat(lock->l_req_mode, req->l_req_mode)) {
00122                         /* jump to last lock in mode group */
00123                         tmp = mode_tail;
00124                         continue;
00125                 }
00126 
00127                 for (;;) {
00128                         struct list_head *head;
00129 
00130                         /* Advance loop cursor to last lock in policy group. */
00131                         tmp = &list_entry(lock->l_sl_policy.prev,
00132                                               struct ldlm_lock,
00133                                               l_sl_policy)->l_res_link;
00134 
00135                         /* Locks with overlapping bits conflict. */
00136                         if (lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits & req_bits) {
00137                                 /* COS lock mode has a special compatibility
00138                                  * requirement: it is only compatible with
00139                                  * locks from the same client. */
00140                                 if (lock->l_req_mode == LCK_COS &&
00141                                     !ldlm_is_cos_incompat(req) &&
00142                                     ldlm_is_cos_enabled(req) &&
00143                                     lock->l_client_cookie == req->l_client_cookie)
00144                                         goto not_conflicting;
00145                                 /* Found a conflicting policy group. */
00146                                 if (!work_list)
00147                                         RETURN(0);
00148 
00149                                 compat = 0;
00150 
00151                                 /* Add locks of the policy group to @work_list
00152                                  * as blocking locks for @req */
00153                                 if (lock->l_blocking_ast)
00154                                         ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, req,
00155                                                                work_list);
00156                                 head = &lock->l_sl_policy;
00157                                 list_for_each_entry(lock, head, l_sl_policy)
00158                                         if (lock->l_blocking_ast)
00159                                                 ldlm_add_ast_work_item(lock, req,
00160                                                                        work_list);
00161                         }
00162                 not_conflicting:
00163                         if (tmp == mode_tail)
00164                                 break;
00165 
00166                         tmp = tmp->next;
00167                         lock = list_entry(tmp, struct ldlm_lock,
00168                                               l_res_link);
00169                 } /* Loop over policy groups within one mode group. */
00170         } /* Loop over mode groups within @queue. */
00171 
00172         RETURN(compat);
00173 }
00174 
00190 int ldlm_process_inodebits_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 *flags,
00191                                 int first_enq, enum ldlm_error *err,
00192                                 struct list_head *work_list)
00193 {
00194         struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00195         struct list_head rpc_list;
00196         int rc;
00197         ENTRY;
00198 
00199         LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode != lock->l_req_mode);
00200         LASSERT(list_empty(&res->lr_converting));
00201         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
00202         check_res_locked(res);
00203 
00204         /* (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT) is for layout lock right now. */
00205         if (!first_enq || (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT)) {
00206                 *err = ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED;
00207                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT)
00208                         *err = ELDLM_LOCK_WOULDBLOCK;
00209 
00210                 rc = ldlm_inodebits_compat_queue(&res->lr_granted, lock, NULL);
00211                 if (!rc)
00212                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00213                 rc = ldlm_inodebits_compat_queue(&res->lr_waiting, lock, NULL);
00214                 if (!rc)
00215                         RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
00216 
00217                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00218                 ldlm_grant_lock(lock, work_list);
00219 
00220                 *err = ELDLM_OK;
00221                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_CONTINUE);
00222         }
00223 
00224  restart:
00225         rc = ldlm_inodebits_compat_queue(&res->lr_granted, lock, &rpc_list);
00226         rc += ldlm_inodebits_compat_queue(&res->lr_waiting, lock, &rpc_list);
00227 
00228         if (rc != 2) {
00229                 /* If either of the compat_queue()s returned 0, then we
00230                  * have ASTs to send and must go onto the waiting list.
00231                  *
00232                  * bug 2322: we used to unlink and re-add here, which was a
00233                  * terrible folly -- if we goto restart, we could get
00234                  * re-ordered!  Causes deadlock, because ASTs aren't sent! */
00235                 if (list_empty(&lock->l_res_link))
00236                         ldlm_resource_add_lock(res, &res->lr_waiting, lock);
00237                 unlock_res(res);
00238                 rc = ldlm_run_ast_work(ldlm_res_to_ns(res), &rpc_list,
00239                                        LDLM_WORK_BL_AST);
00240                 lock_res(res);
00241                 if (rc == -ERESTART)
00242                         GOTO(restart, rc);
00243                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
00244         } else {
00245                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
00246                 ldlm_grant_lock(lock, NULL);
00247         }
00248         RETURN(0);
00249 }
00250 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
00251 
00252 void ldlm_ibits_policy_wire_to_local(const union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy,
00253                                      union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy)
00254 {
00255         memset(lpolicy, 0, sizeof(*lpolicy));
00256         lpolicy->l_inodebits.bits = wpolicy->l_inodebits.bits;
00257 }
00258 
00259 void ldlm_ibits_policy_local_to_wire(const union ldlm_policy_data *lpolicy,
00260                                      union ldlm_wire_policy_data *wpolicy)
00261 {
00262         memset(wpolicy, 0, sizeof(*wpolicy));
00263         wpolicy->l_inodebits.bits = lpolicy->l_inodebits.bits;
00264 }
